required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Endoscopic Transcanal Tympanoplasty With Attico-antrostomy Versus Endoscopic-assisted Canal Wall up Mastoidectomy in Management of Localized Cholesteatoma: A Randomized Clinical Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Endoscopic Transcanal Tympanoplasty With Attico-antrostomy Versus Endoscopic-assisted Canal Wall up Mastoidectomy in Management of Localized Cholesteatoma: A Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: the main objective of the study is to compare endoscopic transcanal tympanoplasty with attico-antrostomy with endoscopic assisted canal wall up mastoidectomy in treatment of limited attic cholesteatoma.

primary_outcome.description: number of participants with no recurrence documented by second look surgery or MRI diffusion

arm_group.arm_group_label: endoscopic assisted canal wall up mastoidectomy

intervention.description: Transcanal approach followed by atticotomy to remove the attic cholesteatoma sac

intervention.intervention_name: endoscopic assisted canal wall up mastoidectomy
intervention.description: traditional canal wall up mastoidectomy followed by endoscopic evaluation of the attic to exclude any remnant cholesteatoma
intervention.arm_group_label: endoscopic assisted canal wall up mastoidectomy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cases of cholesteatoma limited to the middle ear and/or attic but not extending beyond the posterior end of the lateral semicircular canal (LSCC) proved radiologically with computed tomography (CT) scan
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cases in which cholesteatoma extended beyond the attic were excluded as being potentially beyond the limits of the TEES approach

facility.name: ORL-HNS department,Mansoura University Hospital, Faculty of Medicine, Mansoura University
